a.g: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
أما تتدبرين قوله تعالى اقترب للناس حسابهم وهم في غفلة معرضون ما يأتيهم من ذكر من ربهم محدث إلا استمعوه وهم يلعبون لاهية قلوبهم ويحك يا نفس إن كانت جراءتك على معصية الله لاعتقادك أن الله لا يراك فما أعظم كفرك وإن كان مع علمك باطلاعه عليك فما أشد وقاحتك وأقل حياءك ويحك يا نفس لو واجهك عبد من عبيدك بل أخ من إخوانك بما تكرهينه كيف كان غضبك عليه ومقتك له فبأى جسارة تتعرضين لمقت الله وغضبه وشديد عقابه أفتظنين أنك تطيقين عذابه هيهات هيهات جربى نفسك إن ألهاك البطر عن أليم عذابه فاحتبسى ساعة في الشمس أو فى بيت الحمام أو قربى أصبعك من النار ليتبين قدر طاقتك أمتغترين بكرم الله وفضله واستغنائه عن طاعتك وعبادتك فما لك لا تعولين على كرم الله تعالى في مهمات دنياك فإذا قصدك عدو فلم تستنبطين الحيل في دفعه ولا تكلينه إلى كرم الله تعالى وإذا أرهقتك حاجة إلى شهوة من شهوات الدنيا مما لا ينقضى إلا بالدينار والدرهم فما لك تنزعين الروح في طلبها وتحصيلها من وجوه الحيل فلا تعولين على كرم الله تعالى حتى يعثر بك على كنز أو يسخر عبدا من عبيده فيحمل إليك حاجتك من غير سعى منك ولا طلب أفتحسبين أن الله كريم في الآخرة دون الدنيا وقد عرفت أن سنة الله لا تبديل لها وأن رب الآخرة والدنيا واحد وأن ليس للإنسان إلا ما سعى ويحك يا نفس ما أعجب نفاقك ودواعيك الباطلة فإنك تدعين الإيمان بلسانك وأثر النفاق ظاهر عليك ألم يقل لك سيدك ومولاك وما من دابة في الأرض إلا على الله رزقها وقال في أمر الآخرة وأن ليس للإنسان إلا ما سعى فقد تكفل لك بأمر الدنيا خاصة وصرفك عن السعى فيها فكذبته بأفعالك وأصبحت تتكالبين على طلبها تكالب المدهوش المستهتر ووكل أمر الآخرة إلى سعيك فأعرضت عنها إعراض المغرور المستحقر ما هذا من علامات الإيمان لو كان الإيمان باللسان فلم كان المنافقون في الدرك الأسفل من النار ويحك يا نفس كأنك لا تؤمنين بيوم الحساب وتظنين أنك إذا مت انفلت وتخلصت وهيهات أتحسبين أنك تتركين
Indeed, do you not contemplate His saying, the Most High: "The reckoning [hisab] for the people has drawn near, while they are in heedlessness [ghafla], turning away. No new reminder [dhikr] comes to them from their Lord except that they listen to it while they play, their hearts [qulub] distracted [lahiya]." Woe to you, O soul [nafs]! If your boldness in disobeying Allah stems from your belief that Allah does not see you, then how great is your disbelief [kufr]! And if it is with your knowledge of His awareness of you, then how severe is your insolence and how little your shame! Woe to you, O soul [nafs]! If a servant from your servants, or even a brother from your brothers, were to confront you with what you dislike, how great would be your anger towards him and your loathing of him? With what audacity, then, do you expose yourself to the loathing, anger, and severe punishment of Allah? Do you suppose you can bear His punishment? Far, far from it! Test yourself, O soul [nafs]! If heedlessness [ghafla] has distracted you from His painful punishment, then confine yourself for an hour in the sun, or in a bathhouse, or bring your finger near the fire, so that the extent of your capacity may become clear. Are you deluded by the graciousness [karam] of Allah and His bounty, and His independence from your obedience and worship? Then why do you not rely on the graciousness [karam] of Allah, the Most High, in the pressing matters of your worldly life [dunya]? If an enemy intends you harm, why do you not devise stratagems to repel him, nor entrust him to the graciousness [karam] of Allah, the Most High? And if a need for a desire from the desires of the worldly life [dunya] overwhelms you—a desire that is only fulfilled by a dinar or a dirham—why do you exert your spirit [ruh] in seeking and acquiring it through all manner of schemes, and you do not rely on the graciousness [karam] of Allah, the Most High, that He might cause you to stumble upon a treasure or subjugate a servant from His servants to carry your need to you without any effort or seeking on your part? Do you reckon that Allah is gracious [karim] in the Hereafter [Akhira] but not in the worldly life [dunya]? Yet you know that the way [sunnah] of Allah is not subject to change, and that the Lord of the Hereafter [Akhira] and the worldly life [dunya] is One, and that for man there is only what he strives for. Woe to you, O soul [nafs]! How astonishing is your hypocrisy [nifaq] and your false pretexts! For you claim faith [iman] with your tongue, yet the mark of hypocrisy [nifaq] is apparent upon you. Did not your Master and Protector say to you: "And there is no creature on earth but that its provision [rizq] is upon Allah"? And concerning the matter of the Hereafter [Akhira], He said: "And that for man there is only what he strives for." Thus, He has guaranteed your worldly affair [dunya] specifically and diverted you from striving in it, yet you have belied Him with your actions and have become avidly engrossed in seeking it, like one who is stunned and reckless. And He has entrusted the affair of the Hereafter [Akhira] to your striving, yet you have turned away from it like one deluded and contemptuous. What is this from the signs of faith [iman]? If faith [iman] were with the tongue alone, then why would the hypocrites [munafiqun] be in the lowest depth of the Fire? Woe to you, O soul [nafs]! It is as if you do not believe in the Day of Reckoning [yawm al-hisab] and you suppose that when you die, you will escape and be free. Far from it! Do you suppose you will be left alone?

a.g: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play

With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"
The Prophet said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."

w.e: maka hendaknya dia mendatangkan kepada kita

a.g: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."
Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?
And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.
And We did not make the prophets forms not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].
Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.
We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?
And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.
And when its inhabitants perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.
[Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."
They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].
And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم انظر إلى عجائب الجو وما يظهر فيه من الغيوم والرعود والبروق والأمطار والثلوج والشهب والصواعق فهى عجائب ما بين السماء والأرض وقد أشار القرآن إلى جملة ذلك فى قوله تعالى وما خلقنا السموات والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين وهذا هو الذى بينهما
Then look upon the wonders of the atmosphere [al-jaww] and what manifests within it of clouds [al-ghumūm], thunder [al-ru'ūd], lightning [al-burūq], rains [al-amṭār], snows [al-thulūj], meteors [al-shuhub], and thunderbolts [al-ṣawā'iq]. These are wonders between the heaven [al-samā'] and the earth [al-arḍ]. And the Qur'an has alluded to the totality of this in His, the Exalted's, saying: "And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them in play [lā'ibīn]." And this is that which is between them.

a.g: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.
Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وفي مثله قوله تعالى: (ولكم الويل مما تصفون( (الأنبياء: 18). ومنها النفاق، فلا يحتاج إلى ذكر الشواهد في ذمه وهم مضطرون إليه فإنهم يلقون الخصوم ومحبيهم وأشياعهم ولا يجدون بدا من التودد إليهم باللسان وإظهار الشوق والاعتداد بمكانهم وأحوالهم ويعلم ذلك المخاطب والمخاطب وكل من يسمع منهم أن ذلك كذب وزور ونفاق وفجور فإنهم متوددون بالألسنة متباغضون بالقلوب نعوذ بالله العظيم منه.
Indeed, in its likeness is the saying of the Exalted: "And woe to you for what you describe" (Al-Anbiya': 18). And among these [descriptions] is hypocrisy [nifaq], which requires no mention of proofs for its censure, for they are compelled to it. They meet their opponents, their loved ones, and their partisans, and they find no alternative but to show affection to them with the tongue, and to display longing and esteem for their status and their conditions. And the one addressed, and the addresser, and everyone who hears from them knows that this is falsehood [kadhib], fabrication [zur], hypocrisy [nifaq], and transgression [fujur]. For they are affectionate with their tongues while harboring hatred in their hearts [qulub]. We seek refuge in Allah, the Almighty, from it.

a.g: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.
They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد وصف الله تعالى الملائكة عليهم السلام مع تقدسهم عن الذنوب ومواظبتهم على العبادات على الدءوب بالإشفاق فقال تعالى مخبراً عنهم "يسحبون الليل والنهار لا يفترون وهم من خشيته مشفقون" فمتى زال الإشفاق والحذر مما سبق به القضاء في الأزل - وينكشف عند خاتمة الأجل - غلب الأمن من مكر الله وذلك يوجب الكبر وهو سبب الهلاك. فالكبر دليل الأمن والأمن مهلك. والتواضع دليل الخوف وهو مسعد؛ فإذن ما يفسده العابد بإضمار الكبر واحتقار الخلق والنظر إليهم بعين الاستصغار أكثر مما يصلحه بظاهر الأعمال. فهذه معارف بها يزال داء الكبر عن القلب لا غير، إلا أن النفس بعد هذه المعرفة قد تضمر التواضع وتدعي البراءة من الكبر وهي كاذبة، فإذا وقعت عادت إلى طبعها ونسيت وعدها، فعلى هذا لا ينبغي أن يكتفي في المداواة بمجرد المعرفة بل ينبغي أن تكمل بالعمل وتجرب بأفعال المتواضعين في مواقع هيجان الكبر في النفس.
Indeed, God the Exalted has described the angels [al-mala'ikah], upon them be peace, despite their sanctity from sins and their constant diligence in worship, with *apprehension* [al-ishfaq]. Thus, He the Exalted said, informing about them: "They glorify [Him] night and day, without ceasing, and they are apprehensive [mushfiqun] from fear of Him." So when this apprehension [al-ishfaq] and caution from what has been decreed by preordainment [al-qada'] in eternity [al-azal]—and which is unveiled at the conclusion of one's appointed term [al-ajal]—is removed, then a feeling of security [al-amn] from the guile of God prevails. And that necessitates arrogance [al-kibr], which is the cause of perdition. So arrogance [al-kibr] is the indicator of security [al-amn], and security [al-amn] is destructive. And humility [al-tawadu'] is the indicator of fear [al-khawf], and it is the means to felicity. Therefore, what the worshipper corrupts by harboring arrogance [al-kibr] and contempt for creation, and by looking upon them with an eye of belittlement, is more than what he rectifies with the outward appearance of deeds. These are insights [ma'arif] by which the disease of arrogance [al-kibr] is removed from the heart [al-qalb], nothing else. However, the soul [al-nafs] after this knowledge [al-ma'rifah] may harbor humility [al-tawadu'] and claim innocence from arrogance [al-kibr] while it is lying. So when an opportunity arises, it returns to its base nature and forgets its promise. Therefore, based on this, one should not be content in the treatment with mere knowledge [al-ma'rifah]. Rather, it must be completed with action [al-'amal] and tested by the acts of the humble in situations where the stirring of arrogance [al-kibr] arises in the soul [al-nafs].

a.g: Or have men taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?
Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإن في عالم الشهادة أيضاً توحيداً، إذ يعلم كل أحد أن المنزل يفسد بصاحبين، والبلد يفسد بأميرين، فيقال له على حد عقله إله العالم واحد والمدبر واحد، إذ لو كان فيهما آلهة إلا الله لفسدتا، فيكون ذلك على ذوق ما رآه في عالم الشهادة، فينغرس اعتقاد التوحيد في قلبه بهذا الطريق اللائق بقدر عقله، وقد كلف الله الأنبياء أن يكلموا الناس على قدر عقولهم، ولذلك نزل القرآن بلسان العرب على حد عادتهم في المحاورة.
Indeed, in the world of witnessing [‘alam al-shahadah] there is also a proof of Oneness [tawhid], for everyone knows that a household is ruined by two masters, and a city is ruined by two rulers. So it is said to him, according to the measure of his intellect [‘aql]: the God of the worlds is One and the Manager is One, for if there were in them gods besides God, they would surely be ruined. Thus, this is according to the direct experience [dhawq] of what he has seen in the world of witnessing [‘alam al-shahadah], so the belief in Oneness [i'tiqad al-tawhid] becomes firmly rooted in his heart [qalb] by this path, which is suitable to the capacity of his intellect [‘aql]. And God has charged the Prophets to speak to people according to the measure of their intellects [‘uqul], and for this reason the Qur'an was revealed in the tongue of the Arabs, according to the limit of their custom in discourse.

a.g: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وعند هذا كاد أن يزيغ ويطلق بالجراءة لسان السؤال، فثبت بالقول الثابت ونودي من وراء حجاب سرادقات الحضرة " لا يسأل عما يفعل وهم يسألون " فغشيته هيبة الحضرة، فخر صعقاً يضطرب في غشيته
Indeed, at this point, he nearly deviated and, with audacity, was about to let loose the tongue of questioning. But he was made firm by the firm word [al-qawl al-thābit], and he was called from behind the veil [ḥijāb] of the pavilions of the Presence [al-ḥaḍrah]: "He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned." Then the awe [haybah] of the Presence [al-ḥaḍrah] overwhelmed him, and he fell down thunderstruck, convulsing in his swoon.

a.g: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya

a.g: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.
They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.
He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فمن الذنوب ما لا تنجي منه الشفاعة وعنه العبارة بقوله تعالى "ولا يشفعون إلا لمن ارتضى" وبقوله "من ذا الذي يشفع عند إلا بإذنه" وبقوله "ولا تنفع الشفاعة عنده إلا لمن أذن له" وبقوله "فما تنفعهم شفاعة الشافعين"
Indeed, from the sins [dhunub] are those from which intercession [shafa'a] does not save, and concerning which the expression [al-'ibara] is nullified, by His saying, the Most High: "And they do not intercede [yashfa'una] except for whom He has approved [irtada]" (Quran 21:28), and by His saying: "Who is it that can intercede [yashfa'u] with Him except by His permission [bi-idhnihi]?" (Quran 2:255), and by His saying: "And intercession [al-shafa'a] does not benefit with Him except for one to whom He has given permission [adhdhana lahu]" (Quran 34:23), and by His saying: "So the intercession [shafa'a] of the intercessors [al-shafi'in] will not benefit them" (Quran 74:48).

a.g: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him"- that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وذم المعرضين عنها فقال وجعلنا السماء سقفا محفوظا وهم عن آياتها معرضون فأى نسبة لجميع البحار والأرض إلى السماء وهى متغيرات على القرب والسموات صلاب شداد محفوظات عن التغير إلى أن يبلغ الكتاب أجله ولذلك سماه الله تعالى محفوظا فقال وجعلنا السماء سقفا محفوظا
And He censured those who turn away from it, saying: "And We made the sky a protected roof [saqfan mahfūthan], yet they turn away from its signs [āyātihā]." So what is the proportion of all the seas and the earth to the sky, when they are things subject to change in proximity, while the heavens are solid, mighty, protected [mahfūthāt] from change until the Book reaches its appointed term? And for that reason, He, the Exalted, named it 'protected' [mahfūthan], saying: "And We made the sky a protected roof [saqfan mahfūthan]."

a.g: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.
And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?
Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.

And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who insults your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.
Man was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not impatiently urge Me.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومن أبوابه العظيمة العجلة وترك التثبت في الأمور وقال صلى الله عليه وسلم العجلة من الشيطان والتأني من الله تعالى وقال عز وجل خلق الإنسان من عجل وهذا لأن الأعمال ينبغي أن تكون بعد التبصرة والمعرفة والتبصرة تحتاج إلى تأمل وتمهل والعجلة تمنع من ذلك وعند الاستعجال يروج الشيطان شره على الإنسان من حيث لا يدري.
Indeed, from its great gates is haste [al-'ajalah] and the abandonment of careful consideration in matters. And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Haste is from Satan, and deliberation is from God, the Exalted." And He, the Mighty, said: "Man was created from haste [min 'ajalin]." This is because actions [al-a'mal] should be after insight [al-tabsirah] and knowledge [al-ma'rifah], and insight requires contemplation [ta'ammul] and deliberation [tamahhul], and haste prevents that. And during haste, Satan markets his evil to man from where he does not perceive.

a.g: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...
Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.
And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.
Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.

But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?
Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."

And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فقد قال الله تعالى ونضع الموازين القسط ليوم القيامة فلا تظلم نفس شيئا وان كان مثقال حبة من خردل أتينا بها وكفى بنا حاسبين فعرف أرباب البصائر من جملة العباد أن الله تعالى لهم بالمرصاد وأنهم سيناقشون في الحساب ويطالبون بمثاقيل الذر من الخطرات واللحظات وتحققوا أنه لا ينجيهم من هذه الأخطار إلا لزوم المحاسبة وصدق المراقبة ومطالبة النفس في الأنفاس والحركات ومحاسبتها في الخطرات واللحظات فمن حاسب نفسه قبل أن يحاسب خف في القيامة حسابه وحضر عند السؤال جوابه وحسن منقلبه ومآبه ومن لم يحاسب نفسه دامت حسراته وطالت في عرصات القيامة وقفاته وقادته إلى الخزى والمقت سيئاته فلما انكشف لهم ذلك علموا أنه لا ينجيهم منه إلا طاعة الله وقد أمرهم بالصبر والمرابطة فقال عز من قائل يا أيها الذين آمنو اصبروا وصابروا ورابطوا فرابطوا أنفسهم أولا بالمشارطة ثم بالمراقبة ثم بالمحاسبة ثم بالمعاقبة ثم بالمجاهدة ثم بالمعاتبة فكانت لهم في المرابطة ست مقامات ولا بد من شرحها وبيان حقيقتها وفضيلتها وتفصيل الأعمال فيها وأصل ذلك المحاسبة ولكن كل حساب فبعد مشارطة ومراقبة ويتبعه عند الخسران المعاتبة والمعاقبة فلنذكر شرح هذه المقامات وبالله التوفيق.
Indeed, God Almighty has said: "And We shall set up the scales of justice [al-mawazin al-qist] for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be wronged at all. Even if it be the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. Sufficient are We as Reckoners." Thus, the possessors of insight [arbab al-basa'ir] from among the servants came to know that God Almighty lies in wait for them, and that they will be scrutinized in the Reckoning [hisab] and held accountable for the weight of an atom [mithaqil al-dharr] from their passing thoughts [khawatir] and glances [lahazat]. And they realized that nothing will save them from these perils except adhering to self-reckoning [muhasaba] and sincere self-observation [muraqaba], and holding the soul [nafs] to account for its breaths [anfas] and movements [harakat], and reckoning with it for its passing thoughts [khawatir] and glances [lahazat]. For whoever holds his soul [nafs] to account before he is held to account, his reckoning [hisab] on the Day of Resurrection [al-Qiyamah] will be light, his answer will be present when questioned, and his return [ma'ab] and outcome [manqalab] will be good. And whoever does not hold his soul [nafs] to account, his regrets [hasrat] will be prolonged, and his halts [waqfat] in the plains ['arasat] of the Day of Resurrection [al-Qiyamah] will be lengthy, and his misdeeds [sayyi'at] will lead him to disgrace [khizy] and contempt [maqt]. When this was unveiled to them, they knew that nothing would save them from it except obedience to God. And He had commanded them to patience [sabr] and vigilant guarding [murabata], so He, the Majestic, said: "O you who believe, be patient, and excel in patience, and guard [rabit], and be mindful of God." So they first guarded their souls [nafs] by mutual stipulation [al-musharata], then by self-observation [al-muraqaba], then by self-reckoning [al-muhasaba], then by self-chastisement [al-mu'aqaba], then by striving [al-mujahada], then by self-admonition [al-mu'ataba]. Thus, for them in vigilant guarding [al-murabata] were six stations [maqamat], and it is necessary to explain them, clarify their reality [haqiqa] and virtue [fadila], and detail the works within them. The foundation of that is self-reckoning [al-muhasaba], but every reckoning [hisab] is after mutual stipulation [musharata] and self-observation [muraqaba], and is followed, in case of loss [khusran], by self-admonition [mu'ataba] and self-chastisement [mu'aqaba]. So let us mention the explanation of these stations, and with God is success.

a.g: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous
Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.
And this [Qur'an] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?
And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأما الرشد فنعنى به العناية الإلهية التى تعين الإنسان عند توجهه إلى مقاصده فتقوبه على ما فيه صلاحه وتفتره عما فيه فساده ويكون ذلك من الباطن كما قال تعالى: ﴿ ولقد آتينا إبراهيم رشده من قبل وكنا به عالمين ﴾ فالرشد عبارة عن هداية باعثة إلى جهة السعادة محركة إليها فالصبى إذا بلغ خبيرا بحفظ المال وطرق التجارة والاستنماء ولكنه مع ذلك يبذر ولا يريد الاستنماء لا يسمى رشيدا لا لعدم هدايته بل لقصور هدايته عن تحريك داعيته فكم من شخص يقدم على ما يعلم أنه يضره فقد أعطى الهداية وميز بها عن الجاهل الذى لا يدرى أنه يضره ولكن ما أعطى الرشد فالرشد بهذا الاعتبار أكمل من مجرد الهداية إلى وجوه الأعمال وهى نعمة عظيمة.
Indeed, as for guidance [al-rushd], We mean by it the divine care [al-'inayah al-ilahiyyah] which assists the human being when he turns towards his objectives, so it steers him towards what contains his rectification and turns him away from what contains his corruption. And this is from the inward [al-batin], just as the Almighty has said: "And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement [rushduhu] before, and We were of him Knowing." (21:51) Thus, guidance [al-rushd] is an expression for an illuminating guidance [hidayah] that urges towards the direction of felicity [al-sa'adah] and impels towards it. For the youth, when he reaches maturity, knowledgeable in safeguarding wealth and the ways of commerce and increasing it, but despite that he squanders and does not desire to increase it, he is not called rightly guided [rashid]—not due to a lack of guidance [hidayah], but due to the deficiency of his guidance [hidayah] in moving his innate impulse [da'iyyah]. For how many a person proceeds towards what he knows will harm him; he has been given the guidance [al-hidayah] and is distinguished by it from the ignorant one who does not know it will harm him, but he has not been given the sound judgement [al-rushd]. Thus, sound judgement [al-rushd], by this consideration, is more complete than mere guidance [al-hidayah] to the aspects of deeds, and it is a great blessing [ni'mah].

a.g: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"
They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."
He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."
They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"
He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.

w.e: sungguh aku akan membuat tipu daya

a.g: And [I swear] by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."
So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].
They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."
They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم تلا قوله عز وجل: ﴿ قالوا سمعنا فتى يذكرهم يقال له إبراهيم ﴾ {} وقوله تعالى: ﴿ إنهم فتية آمنوا بربهم وزدناهم هدى ﴾ {} وقوله تعالى: ﴿ وآتيناه الحكم صبيا ﴾ {} وكان أنس رضي الله عنه يقول (قبض رسول الله ﭬ وليس في رأسه ولحيته عشرون شعرة بيضاء فقيل له: يا أبا حمزة فقد أسن فقال لم يشنه الله بالشيب فقيل أهو شين فقال كلكم يكرهه[76]) ويقال إن يحيى بن أكثم ولي القضاء وهو ابن إحدى وعشرين سنة فقال له رجل في مجلسه يريد أن يخجله بصغر سنه كم سن القاضي أيده الله فقال مثل سن عتاب بن أسيد حين ولاه رسول الله ﭬ إمارة مكة وقضاءها فأفحمه[77] وروي عن مالك رحمه الله أنه قال: قرأت في بعض الكتب لا تغرنكم اللحى فإن التيس له لحية. وقال أبو عمرو بن العلاء: إذا رأيت الرجل طويل القامة صغير الهامة عريض اللحية فاقض عليه بالحمق ولو كان أمية بن عبد شمس. وقال أيوب السختياني: أدركت الشيخ ابن ثمانين سنة يتبع الغلام يتعلم منه. وقال علي بن الحسين: من سبق فيه العلم قبلك فهو إمامك فيه وإن كان أصغر سنا منك. وقيل لأبي عمرو بن العلاء: أيحسن من الشيخ أن يتعلم من الصغير؟ فقال: إن كان الجهل يقبح به فالتعلم يحسن به. وقال يحيى بن معين لأحمد بن حنبل وقد رآه يمشي خلف بغلة الشافعي: يا أبا عبد الله تركت حديث سفيان بعلوه وتمشي خلف بغلة هذا الفتى؟ وتسمع منه فقال له أحمد: لو عرفت لكنت تمشي من الجانب الآخر إن علم سفيان إن فاتني بعلو أدركته بنزول وإن عقل هذا الشاب إن فاتني لم أدركه بعلو ولا نزول.
Indeed, He recited the words of the Almighty: **"They said, 'We heard a youth [fata] mentioning them; he is called Abraham.'"** And the words of the Exalted: **"Indeed, they were youths [fityah] who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance [huda]."** And the words of the Exalted: **"And We gave him sound judgment [hukm] while he was a boy [sabiyyan]."** And Anas, may God be pleased with him, used to say: "The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, was taken [qabida], and there were not twenty white hairs on his head and beard." So it was said to him: "O Abu Hamzah, you have indeed grown old." He said: "God did not disgrace him with gray hair." So it was said: "Is it a disgrace?" He said: "All of you dislike it." And it is said that Yahya ibn Aktham assumed the judgeship [qada'] when he was twenty-one years old. So a man said to him in his council, intending to embarrass him due to his young age: "How old is the judge, may God support him?" He said: "Like the age of 'Attab ibn Usayd when the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, appointed him as the governor and judge of Mecca." So he silenced him. And it is narrated from Malik, may God have mercy on him, that he said: "I read in some books: 'Do not be deceived by the beards, for the billy-goat has a beard.'" And Abu 'Amr ibn al-'Ala' said: "If you see a man tall in stature, small in intellect [hamah], and broad in beard, then judge him to be foolish, even if he were Umayyah ibn 'Abd Shams." And Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani said: "I met a shaykh of eighty years old following a youth to learn from him." And 'Ali ibn al-Husayn said: "Whoever preceded you in knowledge [ilm] is your imam in it, even if he is younger than you." And it was said to Abu 'Amr ibn al-'Ala': "Is it seemly for a shaykh to learn from a younger one?" He said: "If ignorance [jahl] is unbecoming for him, then learning [ta'allum] is becoming for him." And Yahya ibn Ma'in said to Ahmad ibn Hanbal when he saw him walking behind the mule of al-Shafi'i: "O Abu 'Abdillah, you have abandoned the hadith of Sufyan in its elevated chain, and you walk behind the mule of this youth [fata] and listen to him?" So Ahmad said to him: "If you knew, you would be walking from the other side. The knowledge [ilm] of Sufyan, if I miss it through an elevated chain, I can attain it through a lower one. But the intellect ['aql] of this youth, if I miss it, I will not attain it by an elevated chain nor a lower one."

a.g: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."
They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"
He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."
So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."
Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"
He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?
Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah. Then will you not use reason?"
They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."
And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.
And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.
And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.
And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.

Tafsir Al-Ihya

a.g: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.
And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.
And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.
And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.

And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى ففهمناها سليمان خص ما انكشف باسم الفهم
Indeed, the Almighty has said, **"So We gave Solomon understanding [fahm] of it, and to each We gave judgment [hukm] and knowledge ['ilm]"** (21:79). He named what He gave to both of them as knowledge ['ilm] and judgment [hukm], and He specified what Solomon uniquely possessed—the discernment of it—with the name understanding [fahm], and He placed it before judgment [hukm] and knowledge ['ilm]. These matters indicate that in understanding [fahm] the meanings of the Qur'an there is a vast, expansive scope, and that what is transmitted of the outward [zahir] interpretation is not the ultimate limit of perception [idrak] therein.

a.g: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?
And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.
And of the devils were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.
And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allah].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال للشافعي يوما أيما أفضل الصبر أو المحنة أو التمكين، فقال الشافعي رحمه الله: (التمكين درجة الأنبياء ولا يكون التمكين إلا بعد المحنة فإذا امتحن صبر وإذا صبر مكن ألا ترى أن الله عز وجل امتحن إبراهيم عليه السلام ثم مكنه، وامتحن موسى عليه السلام ثم مكنه، وامتحن أيوب عليه السلام ثم مكنه، وامتحن سليمان عليه السلام ثم مكنه وآتاه ملكا، والتمكين أفضل الدرجات قال الله عز وجل (وكذلك مكنا ليوسف في الأرض( (يوسف: 56)، وأيوب عليه السلام بعد المحنة العظيمة مكن، قال الله تعالى (وآتيناه أهله ومثلهم معهم( (الأنبياء: 84) الآية.
Indeed, which is superior: Patience [sabr] or Trial [mihna] or Empowerment [tamkin]? Empowerment [tamkin] is the station [daraja] of the Prophets, and Empowerment [tamkin] does not occur except after Trial [mihna]. For when one is tested, he is patient [sabr], and when he is patient [sabr], he is empowered [tamkin]. Do you not see that God, Mighty and Majestic, tested [imtahana] Abraham, peace be upon him, then empowered him [makkana-hu]? And He tested [imtahana] Moses, peace be upon him, then empowered him [makkana-hu]? And He tested [imtahana] Job, peace be upon him, then empowered him [makkana-hu]? And He tested [imtahana] Solomon, peace be upon him, then empowered him [makkana-hu] and gave him a kingdom? Empowerment [tamkin] is the most superior of stations [darajat]. God, Mighty and Majestic, said: "And thus We empowered Joseph [makkanna li-Yusuf] in the land" (12:56). And Job, peace be upon him, after the great Trial [mihna], was empowered [mukkina]. God, the Exalted, said: "And We restored to him his family and the like of them with them" (21:84), the verse.

a.g: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.
And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.

And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
من قال سبحانك ظلمت نفسي وعملت سوءا فاغفر لي إنه لا يغفر الذنوب إلا أنت غفرت ذنوبه وإن كانت كمدب النمل أخرجه البيهقي في الدعوات من حديث علي أن رسول الله ﭬ قال ألا أعلمك كلمات تقولهن لو كان عليك كعدد النمل أو كعدد الذر ذنوبا غفرها الله لك فذكره بزيادة لا إله إلا أنت في أوله
Indeed, he who said, "Glory be to You [Subḥānaka], I have wronged my soul [ẓalamtu nafsī] and done evil [ʿamiltu sūʾan], so forgive me [faghfir lī], for indeed, none forgives sins [lā yaghfiru l-dhunūba] except You," I forgave his sins, even if they were like the number of ants. Al-Bayhaqī related it in *Al-Daʿawāt* from the ḥadīth of ʿAlī, that the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Shall I not teach you words which, if you say them, even if the sins upon you were like the number of ants or like the number of tiny creatures, God would forgive them for you?" And he mentioned it with the addition of "There is no god but You [lā ilāha illā anta]" at its beginning.

a.g: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.
And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."
So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
بيان أن الدعاء غير مناقض للرضا ولا يخرج صاحبه عن مقام الرضا. ولقد كان رسول الله ﷺ في أعلى المقامات من الرضا. وقد أثنى الله تعالى على بعض عباده بقوله "ويدعوننا رغباً رهباً".
Indeed, the explanation is that supplication [du'a] does not contradict contentment [rida] nor does it remove its practitioner from the station of contentment [maqam al-rida]. And indeed, the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, was in the highest of stations of contentment. And God, the Exalted, has praised some of His servants with His saying: "And they supplicate to Us in hope [raghban] and fear [rahaban]."

a.g: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عز وجل: " فأرسلنا إليها روحنا فتمثل لها بشراً سوياً " ثم قال تعالى: " فنفخنا فيها من روحنا " وكان النافخ جبريل عليه السلام
Indeed, the Almighty has said: "So We sent to her Our Spirit [ruh], and it represented itself to her as a perfect man [basharan sawiyyan]." Then the Exalted said: "So We breathed into her of Our Spirit [ruh]." And the one who breathed was Gabriel, peace be upon him.

a.g: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
And [yet] they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.
So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We, of it, are recorders.
And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return
Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend

And [when] the true promise has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."
Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allah are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.
Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.
For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.
Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولعمري تأدب اللسان والظاهر مما يقدر عليه الأكثرون فأما تأدب السر عن إضمار الاستبعاد بهذا الاختلاف الظاهر في التقريب والإبعاد والإشقاء والإسعاد مع بقاء السعادة والشقاوة أبد الآباد فلا يقوى عليه إلا العلماء الراسخون في العلم ولهذا قال الخضر عليه السلام لما سئل عن السماع في المنام إنه الصفو الزلال الذي لا يثبت عليه إلا أقدام العلماء لأنه محرك لأسرار القلوب ومكامنها ومشوش لها تشويش السكر المدهش الذي يكاد يحل عقدة الأدب عن السر إلا ممن عصمه الله تعالى بنور هدايته ولطيف عصمته ولذلك قال بعضهم ليتنا نجونا من هذا السماع رأسا برأس ففي هذا الفن من السماع خطر يزيد على خطر السماع المحرك للشهوة فإن غاية ذلك معصية وغاية الخطأ ههنا كفر واعلم أن الفهم قد يختلف بأحوال المستمع فيغلب الوجد على مستمعين لبيت واحد واحدهما مصيب في الفهم والآخر مخطىءأو كلاهما مصيبان وقد فهما معنيين مختلفين متضادين ولكنه بالإضافة إلى اختلاف احوالهما لا يتناقض كما حكى عن عتبة الغلام انه سمع رجلا يقول سبحان جبار السما إن المحب لفي عنا فقال صدقت وسمعه رجل آخر فقال كذبت فقال بعض ذوي البصائر أصابا جميعا وهو الحق فالتصديق كلام محب غير ممكن من المراد بل مصدود متعب بالصد والهجر والتكذيب كلام مستأنس بالحب مستلذ لما يقاسيه بسبب فرط حبه غير متأثر به أو كلام محب غير مصدود عن مراده في الحال ولا مستشعر بخطر الصد في المآل وذلك لاستيلاء الرجاء وحسن الظن على قلبه فباختلاف هذه الأحوال يختلف الفهم وحكى عن أبي القاسم بن مروان وكان قد صحب أبا سعيد الخراز رحمه الله وترك حضور السماع سنين كثيرة فحضر دعوة وفيها إنسان يقول واقف في الماء عطشان ولكن ليس يسقى فقام القوم وتواجدوا فلما سكنوا سألهم عن معنى ما وقع لهم من معنى
Indeed, disciplining the tongue and the outward form is something most people are capable of. As for disciplining the inner secret [sirr] from harboring a sense of improbability regarding this apparent disparity in drawing near [taqrib] and casting far, in causing misery [ishqa'] and granting felicity [is'ad], while happiness [sa'ada] and wretchedness [shaqawa] remain for all eternity—none have the strength for this except the scholars firmly rooted in knowledge [al-'ulama' al-rasikhun fi al-'ilm]. And for this reason, Al-Khidr, peace be upon him, when asked about spiritual audition [sama'], said it is the pure, clear water upon which only the feet of the scholars can stand firm, for it stirs the secrets [asrar] and hidden places of the hearts [qulub], and agitates them with the agitation of bewildering intoxication which nearly loosens the knot of inner discipline [adab] from the secret [sirr], except for those whom God, exalted is He, has protected with the light [nur] of His guidance and His subtle protection. Therefore, one of them said, "If only we were saved from this audition head for head." For in this category of audition lies a danger greater than the danger of the audition that stirs desire; the ultimate end of that is sin, while the ultimate end of error here is disbelief [kufr]. And know that understanding [fahm] may differ according to the states of the listener. Ecstasy [wajd] may overcome two listeners from a single verse; one is correct in his understanding and the other is mistaken, or both may be correct, having understood two different, opposing meanings, but relative to the difference in their states, it is not contradictory. As was narrated regarding 'Utbah the youth: he heard a man say, "Glory to the Compeller of the heavens! Indeed, the lover is in neglect ['ina]." He said, "You have spoken truthfully." Another man heard it and said, "You have lied." Someone of insight [basira] said, "They were both correct, and that is the truth." For the affirmation [tasdiq] is the speech of a lover who is not granted access to the Beloved; rather, he is repelled, wearied by rejection, abandonment, and being called a liar. The denial [takdhib] is the speech of one intimate with love, delighting in what he endures due to the intensity of his love, not affected by it, or it is the speech of a lover who is not currently repelled from his goal, nor does he sense the danger of rejection in the ultimate end, due to the dominance of hope and good expectation over his heart [qalb]. Thus, understanding differs according to these differing states. And it was narrated from Abu al-Qasim ibn Marwan—who had kept the company of Abu Sa'id al-Kharraz, may God have mercy on him, and had abandoned attending audition for many years—that he attended a gathering where a person was saying, "Standing in water, thirsty, yet not given to drink." The people rose and were overcome by ecstasy. When they settled, he asked them about the meaning of what had occurred for them from the meaning.

a.g: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.
They will not be grieved by the greatest terror, and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -

The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.
And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.
Indeed, in this [Qur'an] is notification for a worshipping people.
And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.
Say, "It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"
But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.
Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.
And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."
[The Prophet] has said, "My Lord, judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against that which you describe."
